title: Materials Down As Final Trade, Brexit Deal Hopes Fade — Materials Roundup
text:
Producers of metals and other raw materials fell as hopes faded that trade and Brexit deals were close to being signed.

Strategists warn that President Donald Trump's "Phase One" deal with China does not resolve all outstanding issues. "A 'skinny' deal reached on Friday may result in a short-term bounce in risk assets, but we do not see it as a market panacea," said strategists at brokerage Bank of America Merrill Lynch Global Research, in a note to clients.

Similarly, the pound sterling fell sharply against the dollar as doubts resurfaced that the United Kingdom and European Union could reach a deal ahead of the Oct. 31 deadline, despite reported progress on some sticking points last week.

Heavy snowfall and high winds over the past several days buffeted northern Farm Belt states where many farmers faced historic planting delays last spring, as reported earlier.
